title: 109_s1687
content: The Act is titled the "National Breast and Cervical Cancer Early Detection Program Reauthorization Act of 2005." It includes waivers related to grants for preventive health measures for breast and cervical cancers. The National Breast and Cervical Cancer Early Detection Program Reauthorization Act of 2005 allows the Secretary to waive certain requirements under Section 1503 of the Public Health Service Act to leverage private funds or remove barriers to enrollment for qualifying women. The Secretary can grant waivers to States for services related to breast and cervical cancer screenings under certain conditions, without compromising the quality of these services. Waivers are initially granted for 2 years and can be extended for additional 2-year periods upon State request. The Secretary can extend waivers for breast and cervical cancer screenings for additional 2-year periods upon State request if it is determined that there will be a barrier to enrollment of qualifying women or if the State will use the waiver to leverage private funds. The Secretary can extend waivers for breast and cervical cancer screenings for additional 2-year periods upon State request to supplement services without reducing the number of women receiving them or compromising quality. Reporting requirements are included in evaluations and reports. The evaluations and reports required under section 1508 include descriptions of the total dollars leveraged annually from private entities in States with waivers, the percentage of grants expended on specific services, the number of States receiving waivers annually, and the number of services provided in States with waivers. The Public Health Service Act is amended to increase appropriations to $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2006 and provide necessary funds for fiscal years 2007 through 2011.
